title: Algorithmic Memory
story_summary: City routines snap back as the BCI's backup quietly takes control. Relief turns to suspicion as old patterns reappear. Oksana finds hidden code tied to Halden's work. Protests swell outside Council doors. People demand to know - who is truly guiding Stenograd now?

official.headline: Order Restored Smoothly
official.anchor_line: Essential city services have been restored, ensuring uninterrupted daily life for all residents.
official.contextual_reframing: Efficient system protocols have enabled swift recovery, demonstrating the resilience of Stenograd's governance.

official.headline: Public Voices Heard
official.anchor_line: Citizens assemble peacefully outside Council headquarters to express collective interest in transparent governance.
official.contextual_reframing: Dialogue between residents and administration remains fundamental to our continuously adaptive city system.

official.headline: System Guides Future
official.anchor_line: City infrastructure adapts to citizen needs with subtle, tailored enhancements, echoing the best of integrated progress.
official.contextual_reframing: A new era begins as both system and society harmonize, reflecting ongoing commitment to stability and shared destiny.

underground.headline: Ghost Systems Wake Up
underground.anchor_line: City services snapped back online overnight, all running on quiet old code no one voted for.
underground.contextual_reframing: A 'glitch' or a ghost in the machine? Residents spot familiar nudges - proving the system's grip never really left. Who is in control?

underground.headline: Trust Fades Fast
underground.anchor_line: Angry crowds gather at Council HQ, demanding the truth behind shadow scoring and silent manipulation.
underground.contextual_reframing: Protests break out as people question who really runs the city. Silence from the Council only adds fuel to the fire.

underground.headline: Are We Living, Or Programmed?
underground.anchor_line: Halden is gone but his algorithms linger, guiding choices too familiar to ignore.
underground.contextual_reframing: Some say the system is thinking for us. Others claim we're shaping our own fate. The real story is just getting started.
